intro: Pouzolzia palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's pouzolzia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, typically found in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Pouzolzia palmeri is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
